1.Name: Set TS Start Time
1.Description: To be used later to determine how long the TS ran

6.Name: Set Power Scheme to High Performance

7.Name: Set TSVariable (OSDVer)
7.Description: OSDVer contains the version of the task sequence (i.e. 1.0, 2.5, 5.0, etc.) and is used by the script to keep the results from different versions of the sequence separated.

8.Name: Set TSVariable (OSDBranch)
8.Description: OSDBranch is a variable I use to identify what stage the sequence is currently (i.e. DEV/QA/PILOT/PROD).  The script will use this to keep results from Development builds from skewing results from Production builds.

9.Name: Set TSVariable (OSDResultsShare)
9.Description: The PowerShell script that does the work of collecting the data and writing it out to the CSV file is relatively simple. It pulls in the required variables, calculates the elapsed runtime in minutes and used WMI to query the computer model. This is all the

10.Name: Debugging
10.Description: Only enable if needed for debugging purposes

1.Name: Set Dell BIOS Package Variables - Prod
1.Description: This Step maps the model to the BIOS packages required.
1.Conditions: --B--WMI Query:--/B----CRLF----TAB--Select * From Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE Manufacturer LIKE "%DELL%"--CRLF----B--Task Sequence Variable:--/B----CRLF----TAB--PREPROD_BIOS notEquals TRUE

2.Name: Set Dell Driver Package Variables - Prod
2.Description: This Step maps the model to the BIOS packages required.
2.Conditions: --B--WMI Query:--/B----CRLF----TAB--Select * From Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE Manufacturer LIKE "%DELL%"--CRLF----B--Task Sequence Variable:--/B----CRLF----TAB--PREPROD_DRIVER notEquals TRUE

3.Name: Set Dell BIOS Package Variables - Pre-Prod
3.Description: This Step maps the model to the BIOS packages required.
3.Conditions: --B--WMI Query:--/B----CRLF----TAB--Select * From Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE Manufacturer LIKE "%DELL%"--CRLF----B--Task Sequence Variable:--/B----CRLF----TAB--PREPROD_BIOS equals TRUE

4.Name: Set Dell Driver Package Variables - Pre-Prod
4.Description: This Step maps the model to the BIOS packages required.
4.Conditions: --B--WMI Query:--/B----CRLF----TAB--Select * From Win32_ComputerSystem WHERE Manufacturer LIKE "%DELL%"--CRLF----B--Task Sequence Variable:--/B----CRLF----TAB--PREPROD_DRIVER equals TRUE

2.Name: Install Dell Command Update

5.Name: Set TS Var "SMSTS_UpdateTime"
5.Action: smsswd.exe /run: powershell.exe -command "&{$tsenv = New-Object -COMObject Microsoft.SMS.TSEnvironment; $tsenv.Value('SMSTS_UpdateTime') = Get-Date -Format yyyyMMddTHHmmss}"
5.Description: Used to make the Logs unique if process runs more than once

6.Name: Make Folder DCU for Results
6.Action: smsswd.exe /run: cmd.exe /c if Not Exist "C:\Temp\DCU" (md C:\Temp\DCU)
6.Description: This folder & Subfolder are used to Store the setting template xml files, along with the reports genearated by DCU

7.Name: Make Folder DCULogs for Logs
7.Action: smsswd.exe /run: cmd.exe /c if Not Exist "C:\Temp\DCULogs" (md C:\Temp\DCULogs)
7.Description: This Folder Collects the XML Log Files and time stamps them for historical viewing

2.Name: Set TS Var "SMSTS_BIOSStartTime"

2.Description: Creates Variable with Time, which will be used later to figure out the time taken for proces to run

1.Name: ConfigMgr Care and Feeding
1.Description: Fixs a bunch of little issues and makes things run smoother

1.Name: Set Power Scheme to High Performance
1.Description: Runs the task sequence with maximum performance to improve responsiveness and decreasing total imaging time

2.Name: Allow Command Line
2.Description: This prevents command line from being launched, so we clear it to enable troubleshooting
2.Conditions: ---I--If all of these conditions are true:--/I----CRLF----TAB----B--File Exists:--/B----CRLF----TAB----TAB--c:\Windows\Setup\scripts\DisableCMDRequest.TAG

3.Name: Set CCM Service to Auto Start
3.Description: CCM defaults to Auto-Delayed, but CCMEval will set it to Auto.  We bump it to Auto which speeds up the service (and TS) starting up after a reboot.

4.Name: WMI Service Settings
4.Description: Changes WMI to be in a higher level group so it starts sooner

5.Name: Group Policy Service Settings
5.Description: Changes group policy to be a stand alone service.  This handles an issue where the very first logon fails.

6.Name: PowerShell Default Policies
6.Description: Sets the default policies so that PowerShell scripts can run while Windows is being deployed.  Fixes issues with PowerShell scripts running and Application deployments that use PowerShell detection methods.

2.Name: Script: Config WoL Settings
2.Description: Diese Script setzt WoL Einstellungen im BIOS und in Windows sowie der LAN-NIC

2.Name: WMI Static Port
2.Description: Sets WMI to run off a static port

3.Name: WMI Firewall Exception
3.Action: smsswd.exe /run: cmd /c netsh firewall add portopening TCP 24158 WMIFixedPort
3.Description: Adds a rule to the firewall to allow WMI connections
